hero_section.title: Ministry of Sports and Youth Development
hero_section.welcome_statement: Welcome to the Ministry of Youth and Sports Development, Imo State the heartbeat of youth empowerment and sporting excellence in our dear state. Guided by the vision of building a vibrant, talented, and globally competitive generation, we are committed to creating opportunities that inspire our young people to reach their full potential. Through strategic programs, modern sports infrastructure, and collaborative partnerships, we strive to nurture talent, promote healthy lifestyles, and unite communities through the power of sports. Together, we are shaping champions on and off the field.
hero_section.mission_statement: Ministry of sports is geared towards ensuring the development of sports and foster sporting activities in the state.
hero_section.vision: To build a dynamic, inclusive, and high-performing generation of youth, celebrated for sporting prowess, leadership, and community vitality.

sections.name: Mission / Vision / Mandate
sections.mandate:
Talent identification & grassroots development: Engaging local government areas (LGAs) across the state to identify young sporting talents for the National Sports Festival and other competitions

Supporting women and youth football: Oversight for Heartland Queens FC and support for their welfare, transport, and performance development strategies

Promotion of mini-football: Meeting held with Imo Mini Football Association to integrate mini­-football into state sports programs

Collaboration with SWAN: Working closely with the Sports Writers Association of Nigeria to boost media coverage, youth talent projection, and broader participation

sections.content: Policy, infrastructure, talent, mass participation, stakeholder collaboration

departments.name: Department of Sports Development
departments.function: Designs and implements sports policies, manages state teams and competitions (e.g., National Sports Festival), and promotes grassroots sports development.

departments.name: Department of Youth Development
departments.function: Engages youth in empowerment programs, entrepreneurship, and leadership training. Coordinates NYSC affairs.

departments.name: Department of Talent Hunt and Empowerment
departments.function: Identifies young talents in sports and supports them with training, exposure, and mentorship.

departments.name: Department of Planning, Research & Statistics
departments.function: Monitors and evaluates the ministry's programs, conducts research for policy development, and manages data/statistics.

departments.name: Department of Administration & General Services
departments.function: Handles the internal administration of the ministry, including logistics, records, staff matters, and supplies.

departments.name: Department of Finance & Accounts
departments.function: Manages budgeting, fund disbursement, and financial reporting within the ministry.

departments.name: Department of Sports Infrastructure & Facility Management
departments.function: Oversees the construction, renovation, and maintenance of stadiums and sports complexes.

departments.name: Department of Public Relations / Media & Outreach
departments.function: Manages the ministry's public communication, coordinates with SWAN, and promotes events.

programs.name: Capacity-Building & Training Programs
programs.description: Hosted a "Teaching the Teachers for Students Development" seminar to empower School Games Masters across secondary schools in Imo State. This initiative strengthens grassroots sports delivery.

programs.name: Talent Identification & Football Scouting
programs.description: Organized a 3-day football scouting programme at Dan Anyiam Stadium with European club officials to discover promising young players for local and international careers.

programs.name: Sports Academy Planning
programs.description: Plans are underway to establish a state sports academy for systematic talent identification and training.

programs.name: Grassroots Development & Partnerships
programs.description: Partnered with Ex‑Iwuanyanwu National (Heartland FC alumni) for youth football development and entry pathways.

programs.name: Mini‑Football Promotion & Integration
programs.description: Endorsed mini-football and partnered with the Imo State Mini Football Association to promote and integrate the sport in local programs.

programs.name: International Coaching Upgrades & Events
programs.description: Rolled out coaching programmes and signed an MoU with Spanish authorities to raise coaching and athlete welfare standards.

programs.name: Media, Stakeholder Engagement & Promotion
programs.description: Collaborated with SWAN and sports media to promote ministry activities and youth empowerment projects.

recent_news.title: Liaison Committee Formed for Niger Delta Sports Festival
recent_news.summary: Commissioner Onyeocha inaugurated the Imo State Liaison Committee at the State Secretariat in Owerri. The committee, chaired by Permanent Secretary Lady Ngozi Duru Victoria, includes sports directors and private sector reps.

recent_news.title: U‑25 Athlete Mobilisation
recent_news.summary: Imo State registered over 600 Under‑25 athletes in 17 disciplines for the Niger Delta Sports Festival. Trials and camps were held at Dan Anyiam Stadium.

recent_news.title: Grassroots Talent Hunt Drive
recent_news.summary: The Ministry intensified grassroots scouting in collaboration with stakeholders and the diaspora.

recent_news.title: Support for Mini‑Football Expansion
recent_news.summary: The Ministry partnered with the Mini Football Association to integrate mini-football into the state's youth programs.

recent_news.title: Preparation for National Sports Festival
recent_news.summary: Plans are underway for Imo to compete in the 2025 NSF in Abeokuta with 400 athletes across 16 events.

recent_news.title: Stakeholder Meeting: Focus on Grassroots & Welfare
recent_news.summary: Amb. Eleazer Ogbonna donated ₦800,000 toward stadium repairs and facility rehabilitation.

recent_events.name: Imo Youth Marathon – "Running for Peace"
recent_events.details: Over 2,000 youths participating. Winners received ₦500,000 each. Flagged off by Governor Hope Uzodimma.

recent_events.name: U‑25 Athletes in Niger Delta Sports Festival
recent_events.details: Over 600 athletes participated in 17 disciplines. Imo placed 8th overall, winning 42 medals.

recent_events.name: Participation in the 2025 National Sports Festival
recent_events.details: Imo competed. Opened with a basketball win over the host. Unity torch received in Owerri by Governor Uzodimma.

recent_events.name: Mini-Football Integration Meeting
recent_events.details: Ministry pledged to support mini-football with strategic integration into youth programs.

upcoming_events.name: Next Edition of Imo Youth Marathon
upcoming_events.status: Expected following the successful 2025 event. Official confirmation pending; registration will open online.
